node.title: Father and two sons die in horrific Christmas tree accident
node.description: The man and his wife have been described as the "happiest people you will have ever met".
node.content: ["A US man and his two sons were killed in a fire sparked by lights on their Christmas tree that was so ferocious it also burnt down the family home.", "Eric King, 41, and his sons Liam, 11, and Patrick, 8, died in the Christmas morning blaze that also burnt down their family home in Quakertown, Pennsylvania.", "King's wife and other son were hospitalised in the blaze but survived.", "Quakertown police chief Scott McElree said the fire likely started in the family Christmas tree, which he said was \"a violent and robust source\" for a fire.", "\"We will be continuing to investigate to find out why it ignited, but the evidence is very clear that it started in the Christmas tree. It was a real tree,\" McElree told the Bucks County Courier Times.", "\"A Christmas tree burns very quickly and very hot.\"", "The family\u2019s two dogs also died in the blaze. The fire was so fierce that when first responders attempted to enter the house, they were beaten back by the flames.", "A Go Fund Me page set up for the family said King and his wife Kristin were high school sweethearts. The couple is described as the \"happiest people you will have ever met\", and \"you just couldn't help but love them\".", "\"The Quakertown community will be deeply impacted by this great loss,\" the page's organiser wrote."]
